intro: Faramea berryi, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in spring. Its berries, which are small and black when mature, are an important food source for birds and small mammals. Faramea berryi is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its elegant appearance and seasonal flowering.
